channel.title: Comments on: Why MySQL timestamp is 24 seconds different from PHP

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/10/28/why-mysql-timestamp-is-24-seconds-different-from-php/#comment-3558">Anton Oliinyk</a>.
No problem, that was a handy piece of information to know about.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Anton Oliinyk.

No problem, that was a handy piece of information to know about.

item.title: By: Anton Oliinyk
item.dc:creator: Anton Oliinyk
item.description: Joseph, thanks for referring to me. It was a discovery for me too.
item.content:encoded:
Joseph, thanks for referring to me.
It was a discovery for me too.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/10/28/why-mysql-timestamp-is-24-seconds-different-from-php/#comment-3556">Donncha O Caoimh</a>.
Yeah, makes me wonder how many times I may have been hit by this and not noticed.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Donncha O Caoimh.

Yeah, makes me wonder how many times I may have been hit by this and not noticed.

item.title: By: Donncha O Caoimh
item.dc:creator: Donncha O Caoimh
item.description: Never noticed that, but I probably have hit it from time to time but didn't realise what was causing my code to break. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: Never noticed that, but I probably have hit it from time to time but didn’t realise what was causing my code to break. Thanks!
